job.title: Test Engineering Manager
job.description:
Job Title: QA Manager, Test Engineering Manager
Salary: Up to $170K
Location: Onsite Tucson
Requirements: Appium/Selenium, GUI Test Engineering, C, C++, Java, Python/Pearl

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Headquartered in Arizona, we are a leading irrigation product development company that caters to residential and commercial customers all over the world. Currently, we are looking to expand our team in Tucson, AZ and are looking for a strong Sr. Software Engineer with experience in .NET, C#, ASP.NET MVC, WinForms, and Web Development.

What You Will Be Doing

Perform implementation of all automated tests and equipment drivers, which could be written in C, C++, C#, Perl, Python, Java, or other appropriate and cost-effective test automation scripting languages. Eventually managing the QA and Test Engineering Teams.

What You Need for this Position
  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5+ years of experience in Quality Assurance testing GUI such as mobile and web applications
  • Management or supervisory level personnel management or leadership
  • Test Engineering
  • C, C++, Java
  • Appium
  • Selenium
So, if you are a QA Manager with experience, please apply today!

Email Your Resume In Word To

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

Ashley.Upchurch@CyberCoders.com
  • Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : LU1-1630134 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***
Ashley Upchurch - Lead Recruiter - CyberCoders

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
